justification: Charter-mandated entity per citation standards

action: Set to "Members appointed by Mayor, including at minimum representatives from environmental, environmental justice, urban planning, architecture, engineering, coastal protection, construction, critical infrastructure, labor, business, energy, and academic sectors. Also includes Speaker of City Council or designee and Chairperson of Council Committee on Environmental Protection or designee."
justification: Charter-defined appointment mechanism per NYC Charter §20(g). Mayor appoints members with minimum sector representation requirements. Speaker of Council and Council Environmental Protection Committee Chair (or designees) serve ex officio.Charter §20(g)

action: Set to "The Banking Commission designates banks authorized to hold City funds, recommends interest rates for early/late real estate tax payments to City Council, and administers the Banking Development District program to encourage bank branches in underserved neighborhoods."
justification: Charter-defined commission established by NYC Charter §1524. Three-member commission: Mayor (Chair), Comptroller, and Commissioner of Finance. Administratively supported by DOF Treasury Division.Charter §1524: Recent activity (May 2025)
Charter-defined commission. NYC Charter §1524 establishes Banking Commission composition, powers to designate deposit banks and set banking standards
NYC Charter § 1524 - Banking Commission legal authority
Charter-mandated commission per citation standards

action: Set to "Three-member commission: Mayor (Chair), Comptroller, and Commissioner of Finance"
justification: Charter-defined commission composition. Mayor serves as Chair; Comptroller and Commissioner of Finance are ex officio members.Charter §1524 and notes field

action: Set to "Three-member Charter commission: Mayor (Chair), Comptroller, and Commissioner of Finance. Administratively supported by DOF Treasury Division but legally distinct from DOF"
justification: Charter-defined commission governance structure. Commission composition and administrative support relationship. Powers and operational details captured in description field. Historical meeting records and evidence not included as notes field not in published schema

Add new entity. CIAB established by Local Law 38 of 2012 (Responsible Banking Act) and codified in NYC Charter §1524-a. Active 2014-2015 conducting banking needs assessments. Enabling law struck down in 2015 (NY Bankers Assn v. City of NY) as preempted by federal/state law. Board still exists in Charter (current as of Nov 2025) and listed on various rosters but functionally dormant with no evidence of meetings/reports post-2015.Charter §1524-a: 2015 activity: Court decision
Add new entity - alphabetized name same as primary name

Add new entity - CIAB legally exists in Charter but functionally dormant since enabling law struck down in 2015. No evidence of meetings, hearings, or reports post-2015 despite still being listed on official rosters
Add new entity - CIAB is an advisory board within Department of Finance per Charter §1524-a
